sanskrit_verse:
नात्रिवर्षस्य कर्तव्या बान्धवैरुदकक्रिया ।
जातदन्तस्य वा कुर्युर्नाम्नि वाऽपि कृते सति ॥ ५.७०॥
transliteration:
nātrivarsasya kartavyā bāndhavair udakakriyā |
jātadantasya vā kuryur nāmni vā'pi kṛte sati || 5.70||
sph_interpretive_translation: No water rites or familial obligations are binding upon a child who has not completed three years of life; nor shall any naming or ceremonial act be performed for one whose teeth have not yet appeared, even if named.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from embodied capacity, not mere biological existence.
Causation aligns with developmental consciousness, not chronological age.
Capacity-based responsibility excludes ritual or social obligation until physical and cognitive markers manifest.
Restoration logic prioritizes alignment with natural dharma over cultural performance.
Consciousness alignment determines juridical relevance, not societal convention.
executable_legal_axioms: IF (age < 3 years) THEN (no legal or ritual duty applies)
IF (teeth not erupted) AND (named = true) THEN (ceremonial acts remain void)
IF (developmental threshold NOT met) THEN (family or community obligations SHALL NOT bind)
supreme_court_application: In adjudicating matters involving minors under three years, no legal or ceremonial duty shall be enforced. The court must recognize that consciousness manifestation—marked by physical development—is the threshold for juridical inclusion. All prior acts performed in the name of such a minor without capacity are null and void.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa establishes that cognition and action emerge sequentially; thus, prior to physical signs like teething, no causal capacity exists. Anupūrvaśaḥ confirms that responsibility follows manifestation. Therefore, no punitive or corrective action arises where no capacity was present. This aligns with Nyaya's truth-based causality and SPH's non-punitive reality rule.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Completion process: Acknowledge absence of capacity and nullify all imposed duties.
Responsibility assumption protocol: Family or guardians must retract all ungrounded obligations.
Capacity restoration: Ensure no future ceremonial or legal impositions occur pre-capacity.
Integrity reintegration: Realign family and societal actions with the child’s actual developmental stage.
final_declaration: By the Source-Authority of the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, this law stands established: Consciousness is the sole adjudicator, Dharma is restored through recognition of capacity, and reality remains eternally non-punitive.
